faq.title: Why Split apks
faq.description:
First of all, what are split apks and how do we benefit from them:

1.  What are split apks?
It's a zip file which contains the base apk, config apk for your device architecture and language apk.

For example, a typical normal apk has both 32 bit and 64 bit support file, lots of language files and a base apk. So if your device is only 32 bit for example and you only want english language file, why would you want an extra files which you don't even need and will result in taking huge space in your storage.

> Advantages:
  • size of split apk is almost half of normal apk
  • a split apk only has those files which are relevant for your device and architecture

> Disadvantages:
  Difficult to newbies or non-technical people

2. Why split?

Google only distributes the YouTube APKs after version 14.54 in split APKs now , so in order to install Vanced, we have to use SAI (Split APK Installer).
Previously, they provides normal apk making it easy to install apps on every device.

3. why dev's don't patch apks and make apk from it?

It's not like that they can't. It's about increased time in doing this. Converting from apks to apk adds time which they can use that in other ways(both personal and vanced bugs/updates). So please don't ask how to get normal apk. Use old version if you are really lazy or official YT app from play store directly.

faq.title: Microphone
faq.description:
If you're wondering why there is no microphone permission in the root version of Vanced, that's because the APK used to modify Vanced (minAPI17) is missing the microphone permission. The other APK has it (minAPI21) but that lacks the translation. Why? Ask Google 🤷‍♂️

Workaround: use the non-root variant, or stock YouTube.

NOTE: These issues only exists in version 14 and below. The permissions are now fixed from version 15.

faq.title: Exoplayer
faq.description:
1. What is Exoplayer?
ExoPlayer is an application level media player for Android. It provides an alternative to Android’s MediaPlayer API for playing audio and video both locally and over the Internet. ExoPlayer supports features not currently supported by Android’s MediaPlayer API, including DASH and SmoothStreaming adaptive playbacks. Unlike the MediaPlayer API, ExoPlayer is easy to customize and extend, and can be updated through Play Store application updates.

2. Difference between V1 and V2?
V1:

  > Better optimised for low end devices. 

  > Can switch to v1 if V2 starts giving issues to you.

V2: 

  > not supported by low end devices. Might give issues on low end crashes, can cause crashes, glitches, lags, black screen. 

  > More optimised for latest devices released after 2019

NOTE: With version 15.33.34, Exoplayer V2 is forced by Google so if V2 gives issue on your device, switch to V1.

PSA: ExoPlayer V2 is EXPERIMENTAL, don't use it unless you know what you're doing. Don't report crashes if you have it enabled. If you are facing crashes/lags/glitches/etc, Switch to Exoplayer v1.

faq.title: Core
faq.description:
If you having issues related to microG core & vanced and looking for an answer here’s a list so far of what can be done:

1. You need to have at least Pico Gapps to run vanced.

2. You can’t run vanced with microG core because it needs Google Play Services Framework which is available in all Gapps packages.

3. If you are worried about your privacy & don’t want to use Gapps but still want to use Vanced then there are old Nokia phones still available in the market. :)

faq.description:
As of Vanced version 14.21.54 and MicroG version 0.2.6.17455, Chromecast should work by default. If it doesn't, connect to the chromecast with the regular version of youtube. You can then add videos/control using YouTube Vanced.

NOTE: Microg V0.2.11 fixed Chromecast so be sure to update your microg versions if you are running 0.2.10 or lower.

faq.title: How to hide Vanced microG notification
faq.description:
To hide notification of microg from notification panel, disable battery optimisation for microg. If notification doesn't hide, reboot device and it will get fixed.

If even after doing above, notification doesn't go away, 

1. just tap and hold onto that notification

2. tap settings icon on the right and,

3. toggle off notification from there(battery saving exclusion) and notification will no longer appear.
